Bashkirs worshipped twelve gods: winter, summer, rain, wind, trees, people, horses, water, night, day, death, heaven and earth, the one above all being the sky god.

Does every remaining ğ’€­ God have a corresponding star? Every tutelary deity might have been assigned to a faintest star or constellation; We may never find out. On the other hand many stars and consolation had very mundane origins without any associated God. These were marked as ğ’€¯ even for single stars?
